result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel J. Mattson

records.addlTxt:
9:43 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  Defendant Samuel J. Mattson not in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Samuel J. Mattson. 
Atty Hughes requests his clients appearance be waived.  No objection. 
Atty Hughes requests a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:53 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder
Defendant Samuel J. Mattson in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Samuel J. Mattson. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Hughes states he is completing his investigation and requests more time. 
State does not object
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:28 AM Defendant Samuel J. Mattson in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Atty Hughes does request more time to continue his investigation in this matter. 
State does not object.  Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:18 AM Attorney Steven Hughes in court.   Defendant Samuel J. Mattson did not appear.   Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hughes requests his clients appearance be waived. 
State does not object. 
Court waives appearance.  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:14 AM Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Samuel J. Mattson in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.  
 
Waukesha County Sheriff's Deputy Dylan Helmrick sworn in and testified on direct by attorney Pitzo.
Cross examination by Attorney Hughes.
State rests.
State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
Defense objects to bind over believing probable cause has not been established.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  
Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
